Variables

HImageButton

HImageButton is the button that has an image.  HImageButtons can have two states, checked and unchecked.  State transition of a button is done by clicking the mouse on the button or by using a keyboard shortcut.

Summary
HImageButton
HImageButton is the button that has an image.
Instance variables
constructor
draw
Draws the rectangle and the markup of this object on the screen.
refresh
Sets only the image that indicates the state, not the whole markup.
mouseUp
Called when the user clicks the mouse button up on this object.

Instance variables

type’[HImageButton]’
valueA boolean, true when the button is checked, false when it’s not.
imageThe url of an image that indicates false state.
alternateImageThe url of an image that indicates true state.

Extends

HControl

See also

HControl

constructor

constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)

Parameters

_rectAn HRect object that sets the position and dimensions of this control.
_parentClassThe parent view that this control is to be inserted in.
_optionsSee HControl.constructor and HComponentDefaults

draw

draw: function()

Draws the rectangle and the markup of this object on the screen.

See also

HView.draw

refresh

refresh: function()

Sets only the image that indicates the state, not the whole markup.

See also

HView.refresh

mouseUp

Called when the user clicks the mouse button up on this object.  Sets the state of the HImageButton.  It can be 0 or 1.

Parameters

_xThe horizonal coordinate units (px) of the mouse cursor position.
_yThe vertical coordinate units (px) of the mouse cursor position.
_leftButtonFlag, is false when the right mouse button was pressed.  Do not rely on it

See also

HControl.mouseUp

Abstract foundation class for all active visual components that implement events and values.
A Rect object represents a rectangle.
constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)
The first two parameters are the same as with HView, but additionally sets the label and events.
Define default setting here.
draw: function()
Initializes the visual representation of the object, should call at least drawRect.
refresh: function()
This method should be extended in order to redraw only specific parts.
Implement/extend the mouseUp method, if you want to do something special when the mouse button is released and the component instance has focus.
